Introduction to PMIDlotteRy

Guy Twa

gtwa@uab.edu

17 June 2024

Source: vignettes/PMIDlotteRy.Rmd
PMIDlotteRy.Rmd

Basics

Install PMIDlotteRy

R is an open-source statistical environment which can be easily modified to enhance its functionality via packages. PMIDlotteRy is a R package available via GitHub Bioconductor repository. R can be installed on any operating system from CRAN after which you can install PMIDlotteRy by using the following commands in your R session:

devtools::install("gtwa-bio/PMIDlotteRy")

Required knowledge

PMIDlotteRy is a just for fun package that relies on the (PubMed)[https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/] database. Each day, PMIDlotteRy picks a random article from PubMed whose unique ID (PMID) is the day’s lucky number. To interface with PubMed, PMIDlotteRy utilizes the rentrez and XML packages.

Asking for help

As package developers, we try to explain clearly how to use our packages and in which order to use the functions. If you need help, the best route is creating GitHub issues and tweeting. However, please note that if you want to receive help you should adhere to the posting guidelines. It is particularly critical that you provide a small reproducible example and your session information so package developers can track down the source of the error.

Citing PMIDlotteRy

We hope that PMIDlotteRy will be fun, and maybe even useful for you. Please use the following information to cite the package and the overall approach. Thank you!

## Citation info
citation("PMIDlotteRy")
#> <0-length citation>

Quick start to using PMIDlotteRy 

library("PMIDlotteRy")

## check today's hint
lottery_hint()
#> [1] "Today's PMID range in genomics: 38883800-38885530"

## Pick your lottery numbers
lotto_numbers <- sample(38883800:38885530, 5, replace = F)

## Play!
lottery(lotto_numbers)
#> Sorry, better luck next time. 
#> 
#> Check out today's paper in genomics!
#> Title: Investigating demic versus cultural diffusion and sex bias in the spread of Austronesian languages in Vietnam.
#> Authors: Thao DH, Dinh TH, Mitsunaga S, Duy D, Phuong NT, Anh NP, Anh NT, Duc BM, Hue HTT, Ha NH, Ton ND, Hübner A, Pakendorf B, Stoneking M, Inoue I, Duong NT, Hai NV
#> PMID: 38885215

Reproducibility

The PMIDlotteRy package was made possible thanks to:

  • R (R Core Team, 2024)
  • BiocStyle (Oleś, 2024)
  • knitr (Xie, 2024)
  • RefManageR (McLean, 2017)
  • rmarkdown (Allaire, Xie, Dervieux, McPherson, Luraschi, Ushey, Atkins, Wickham, Cheng, Chang, and Iannone, 2024)
  • sessioninfo (Wickham, Chang, Flight, Müller, and Hester, 2021)
  • testthat (Wickham, 2011)

This package was developed using biocthis.

Code for creating the vignette

## Create the vignette
library("rmarkdown")
system.time(render("PMIDlotteRy.Rmd", "BiocStyle::html_document"))

## Extract the R code
library("knitr")
knit("PMIDlotteRy.Rmd", tangle = TRUE)

Citations made with RefManageR (McLean, 2017).
